metadata.Description: Strategies and actions taken to adapt to the impacts of climate change.

entities.Description: Climate resilience funds are financial mechanisms that provide funding for projects and initiatives aimed at enhancing the resilience of communities, ecosystems, and infrastructure to climate change impacts.
Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.
Strategies and actions taken to adapt to the impacts of climate change.
Approaches that use nature and natural processes to address environmental challenges and promote sustainable development.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.

relations.Description: Climate adaptation strategies address the impacts of extreme weather events on communities and infrastructure.

relations.Description: Climate adaptation strategies employ nature-based solutions to enhance resilience and protect ecosystems.

relations.Description: Climate adaptation strategies measure vulnerability to assess the risks and impacts of climate change on communities.

relations.Subject: nature-based solutions
relations.Description: nature-based solutions collaborates with local communities to implement sustainable energy solutions that are in harmony with nature.

relations.Subject: climate resilience funds
relations.Description: climate resilience funds address climate change impacts by supporting projects that enhance resilience to climate-related risks.

relations.Subject: climate resilience funds
relations.Description: climate resilience funds employ climate adaptation strategies to build resilience and mitigate the impacts of climate change.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

relations.Subject: climate adaptation strategies
relations.Description: Climate adaptation strategies address the impacts of extreme weather events on communities and infrastructure.

relations.Subject: community-based energy resilience programs
relations.Description: Community-based energy resilience programs implement energy efficiency measures to reduce energy consumption and promote sustainability.

relations.Subject: climate resilience funds
relations.Description: climate resilience funds address climate change impacts by supporting projects that enhance resilience to climate-related risks.

Resilient infrastructure refers to the design and construction of infrastructure systems that can withstand and recover from the impacts of climate change. It includes measures such as building stronger and more durable structures, improving drainage systems, and implementing flood protection measures.
relations.Subject: resilient infrastructure

relations.Description: Ecosystem-based approaches involve the use of natural ecosystems and biodiversity to adapt to climate change. This includes activities such as restoring and conserving forests, wetlands, and coastal areas, which provide natural protection against climate impacts and enhance resilience.
relations.Subject: ecosystem-based approaches

relations.Description: Climate-resilient agriculture involves the adoption of practices and technologies that enable agricultural systems to withstand and adapt to climate change. This includes techniques such as crop diversification, improved water management, and the use of climate-resistant crop varieties.
relations.Subject: climate-resilient agriculture

relations.Description: Water management strategies are essential for climate adaptation, as changing climate patterns can lead to increased water scarcity or extreme weather events. Effective water management includes measures such as water conservation, efficient irrigation systems, and the development of water storage and distribution infrastructure.
relations.Subject: water management

relations.Description: Disaster risk reduction involves the implementation of measures to reduce the vulnerability of communities and infrastructure to climate-related disasters. This includes activities such as early warning systems, land-use planning, and the construction of resilient shelters and evacuation routes.
relations.Subject: disaster risk reduction
